IN 1867 TESTIMONY NO. 11 APPEARED WITH ITS FIRST ARTICLE, "REFORM 
                                                                           718
IN DRESS." SEE PAGES 456-466. IN THIS THE DRESS QUESTION WAS FULLY REVIEWED AND FURTHER COUNSEL GIVEN. A GENERAL PATTERN WAS RECOMMENDED AS EMBODYING THE PRINCIPLES REVEALED TO MRS. WHITE, AND WAS REFERRED TO AS "WORTHY OF THE NAME OF THE REFORM SHORT DRESS." NO PARTICULAR PATTERN WAS REVEALED TO HER IN VISION, AND, WHEN DISCUSSING THE MATTER AT A LATER DATE, MRS. WHITE STATED:
